content:
@ChrisMayLA6
Re.: #government approaching #election; at which the opposition party seems likely to be voted in.

To be sure, is it not their job, at present, to 'cock it all up' such that the next government has as hard as possible a job to 'fix' it within their time window?

I ask in earnest; a pal suggested it to me as a working theory, and I found it hard to disagree with.

My own feeling leans toward both parties wanting rid of the #NHS (in it's current form), but accepting that to declare such would be #political suicide. As a public we so often clamour for the notion of telling truth to power, and are perhaps blind to the possibility that we are the power who don't like hearing the truth.

I'm a student of neither economics nor politics, so I'd be curious if you had any thoughts.

#healthcare #medmastodon #NHScrisis #cybernetics #finance #privateHealthcare #doctrine #ideology #philosophy #NHSplc

content:
January 16, 2023. Good morning! It's Monday, we should remind everyone that private, for profit health care systems make safe, effective health care inaccessible to much of the population. It turns health care from a right to a privilege. Say NO to privatization.

Under those systems, numbers improve, because people who can't afford to pay for private care, private insurance, or who have complex cases that private insurance won't profit from are denied coverage even if they have insurance. Private is a death sentence for those people.

Low success rate, or high success rate but expensive medical procedures and paths will simply mean people don't get help. Private isn't cheaper, it isn't better, and it isn't equitable. Private systems are designed to make owners rich, not people healthier.

The purpose of health care is to keep the ENTIRE population healthy, to protect the country's economy from collapse, it isn't specifically to help individuals. Having the largest, healthiest population benefits everyone. Private helps fewer people, and hurts a country's economy.☮️❤️🍁

#GoodMorning #PublicHealth #PrivateHealthCare #Privatization #Greed

content:
Not sure if this will actually happen, but if it does it would be a massive game changer. So far it has 23 sponsors in the Michigan House, which is more than I would have expected.

Rep. Carrie Rheingans introduces bill that would establish universal healthcare in Michigan

Rep. Carrie Rheingans (D-Ann Arbor) has introduced a bill that would create a publicly funded health system that would provide comprehensive services in Michigan.

House Bill 4893 would establish a universal healthcare system and reform the current payment system for healthcare coverage in Michigan. It would utilize both private and public providers to offer physical, dental, and mental healthcare without deductibles, copays, or premiums.

Rheingans told State of Reform she is still considering options to fund her proposal for Michigan, but plans to utilize MICare, which all residents would be eligible for. It would include coverage provided under Medicaid, Medicare, MIChild (the state’s child health plan under Title XXI of the Social Security Act), employers that choose to participate, and state and government employees.

#USPol #Politics #Michigan #UniversalHealthCare #SinglePayerHealthCare #HealthCare #Democrats #MIPolitics #MedicareForAll

Mystery! People seem to be more often sick! And it’s not free 😮

The Swiss have universal healthcare. The costs are shared equally among all citizens, with basic health services covered after a self-pay minimum of around $2000 per year.

That's fine. But since the end of the #pandemic in 2021, people seem to need more services. This year costs are rising by ~10%, last year by 6.3%.

content:
Know how things occur to you in hindsight, when the immediate moment doesn’t really provide opportunity for reflection?

Been two years since I was laid off from my job of ten years, and I just now realized…

I’m not salty about the income, my contributions to the org, or even the utter disrespect shown to me with no notice.

I am salty that they laid me off (and ended my health insurance) in the middle of a fucking pandemic, without a second thought.

Your employer offers no loyalty, and doesn’t care about your well being. Consider this your daily reminder that any loyalty you feel towards them is wildly misplaced and will almost certainly be thrown back in your face sooner or later.

#covid19 #CovidIsNotOver #layoff #Healthcare #Union #MedicareForAll

content:
Not sure if this will actually happen, but if it does it would be a massive game changer. So far it has 23 sponsors in the Michigan House, which is more than I would have expected.

Rep. Carrie Rheingans introduces bill that would establish universal healthcare in Michigan

Rep. Carrie Rheingans (D-Ann Arbor) has introduced a bill that would create a publicly funded health system that would provide comprehensive services in Michigan.

House Bill 4893 would establish a universal healthcare system and reform the current payment system for healthcare coverage in Michigan. It would utilize both private and public providers to offer physical, dental, and mental healthcare without deductibles, copays, or premiums.

Rheingans told State of Reform she is still considering options to fund her proposal for Michigan, but plans to utilize MICare, which all residents would be eligible for. It would include coverage provided under Medicaid, Medicare, MIChild (the state’s child health plan under Title XXI of the Social Security Act), employers that choose to participate, and state and government employees.

#USPol #Politics #Michigan #UniversalHealthCare #SinglePayerHealthCare #HealthCare #Democrats #MIPolitics #MedicareForAll

https://stateofreform.com/featured/2023/09/rep-carrie-rheingans-introduces-bill-that-would-establish-universal-healthcare-in-michigan/

content:
@QasimRashid
Since you are running for Congress, I have a sincere question for you:

What are the top 3 most effective tactics Americans can employ right now to further the goal of universal, single-payer healthcare?

We have Medicare For All on the table in both the House and Senate. Badgering our bought-off representatives has proven futile.

I work with universal healthcare advocacy orgs on both the state and national levels, and, often, we are at a loss as to where our *very* limited resources would best be spent.

Sometimes, I feel like making a sign, standing in front of the hospital day after day, shouting about the insanity of our system would be my best use of time.

P.S. I don't live in your jurisdiction, but I hope you win.

#Healthcare #HealthCareIsAHumanRight #USPol #USPolitics #MedicareForAll #Medicare4All #PeopleOverProfit #GetProfitOutOfHealthcare #AbolishMedicareAdvantage #BanACOREACH

card.title: Health care CEOs hauled in $4 billion last year as inflation pinched workers, analysis shows
card.description: The CEOs of some 300 publicly traded health care companies combined to make $4 billion in 2022 — enough to buy Costco memberships for more than 66 million people.

content:
@danwentzel

I agree. Treating health care as a service that human beings require, rather than a tool for destroying people's lives in the name of corporate profit, is one of the most urgent needs in our rapidly disintegrating society.

Let's try to actually get one of those universal health care models implemented, rather than insisting that only one of those models, one that cannot actually be implemented, is the only one that will suffice.

#universalhealthcare #medicareforall #USpol

account.note: American. Pro-democracy.

content:
My friend who emigrated to Spain posted that he had to go to the Emergency Room today. Instead of it breaking his bank account, the visit only cost him €16.

We are being ripped off in ways we don't even realize by the US health “care” non-system which is designed to maximize corporate profits by bankrupting patients.

We need a new model and should adopt one of the universal health care models that get much better health care outcomes than ours. #universalhealthcare #medicareforall #USpol
